page.title: 02INTRODUCTION - History
page.content: The area surveyed lies within the original Domesday Manors of Bissei (Bushey) and Aldenham. St.James's church, built in the Early English style, was founded in 1006 AD. There is evidence of a 15th Century manor house at Bushey Hall Farm. In the 19th Century Bushey developed a tradition of painting centered around Sir Hubert Herkomer and Lucy Kemp-Welch. More recently industrial and transport developments have affected the area. In the late 1950's 2 industrial parks were opened in square 05130197 which led to an enormous development of housing. In the 1960's the M1 motorway was carved through the survey area facilitating quick travel into London and producing high property prices.
